Reviews.Title: believe the hype
Reviews.Author: Eugene Yoon "randomly geek"
Reviews.Content: I just received my TV, set it up and tested it out. First of all, installation was a breeze, camera and mic work beautifully as do the motion controls.More importantly, the image is perfect. I don't know what these other reviewers are going on about but screen uniformity is phenomenal and on par with any of the other LED LCD tvs I've seen. Blacks are deep and inky and with the backlighting on the factory default, I saw no evidence of flashlighting or light creep.3D works like a charm. Set the PS3 to recognize the new screen and the new 3D glasses pair with the TV quickly and easily and don't mind at all if I look away from the screen. Tested out Transformers 3D (don't laugh, I have 6 year old son and he loves them) and the image was crisp, detailed with very little artifacting or crosstalk. I fired up wipeout HD 3D and that performed beautifully as well.For me, it was between this TV and the new Panasonic line up. While I agree that the plasmas handle blacks better than LCD screens, I prefered the image crispness of an LED LCD panel. I am not disappointed and more than happy with the es8000.

Reviews.Title: simply amazing
Reviews.Author: bbilt
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a samsung un55d6000 LED tv...which I found to already have a stunning picture.I purchased the new 8000 series and unboxed it. very nice. placed it on the wall using the ultra slim mounts...and off i went. For starters, I got a good deal on the TV and was just going to try it and turn around and sell it. But after using it I said No way. I'm keeping it. It's just too freaking amazing.Let's start with the picture. I can't say enough about how great my picture is...using my basic tv outdoor antenna. its truly incredible. after a month i still stare at it in amazement. pure joy. and those who complain "on occasion" about the bleeding or whatever. who cares. its during a rare blacked out commercial. get over it. has no issue when watching tv. the picture is stunning.Now on to the small bezel. Well I thought this would be cool but a gimmick. wrong. simply amazing. its all picture...you are looking at. and from a sideview its super thin. crazy. The thin bezel and lighted LED "samsung" at the bottom is very classy. it says expensive. i buy a tv as a piece of furniture just as much as something to watch. beautiful in every way.on to the features: voice control. i don't use it much. i sit too far away to use it by the tv microphone, and don't really use the voice control remote (tv comes with 2 remotes). so i don't really use it. Gestures: cool but doesn't work for me b/c my room is dark. only works in very lighted situations. and even in the middle of day, my room isn't lighted enough. cool feature, and it does work, but i don't really use it much.on the remotes: the touchpad type remote with voice control i don't care for much. i like the standard remote like with the other lesser tv's...and until i get the new keyboard remote then i will stick with this.netflix, vudu etc.. works perfect. no issues.web browser: works good but hope they have the ability to make text bigger when you do searches. (font size increase??) otherwise you stand close to the tv to read browser text. surely they thought of how to do it, but i haven't figured it out.anynet+. works amazingly well with my panasonic bd320 bluray/3d player. plug and play. can use my one remote for that bluray player.tv speakers: they stink. seriously. big deal. love the thin size and bezel.  i bought an klipsch energy powerbar elite with 10" sub. amazing sound. done.dual core processor: works great. no lag. no issues on smart tv apps etc like the older 2011 models.fitness apps. nice addition. especially since its free on samsung tv's.3D picture. really nice. i have to say. even avatar bluray no in 3d was amazing picture/colors.allshare. works great. no issues.dual view with samsung phone/tablet. works perfect. i use it on my tablet on my patio...to watch tv. no issues.overall I think this Tv,PICTURE, bezel, microdimming... are truly stunning.  and remotes aren't perfect. the new keyboard remote will help.so nice to look at. its a keeper.Update: 12/26/12. STILL LOVE THIS TV. LOVE IT EVEN MORE.Even after nearly a year of owning this. this is one amazing piece of equipment. people always comment on the amazing picture and bezel-less display. its phenomenal. and samsung keeps updating the software for smart tv, its quick, has everything needed, and works great. NOW THEY finally UPDATED IT WITH AMAZON INSTANT VIDEO/PRIME APP. which is awesome. I was waiting on that.TRULY an amazing piece of equipment. Skype even works great on it! would have bought it all over again for sure!and the remotes app for the phone work great...as well.web browsing is pretty good as well. fairly quick, yet flash video is spotty. but reading is great. and it has a zoom text feature which is awesome.and allshare works great with my galaxy s3 phone by samsung. pics, videos from the phone shoot up to the 55 in tv. brilliantyou won't be disappointed. this is much better than apple tv plugged into a regular hdmi tv. by far.not even a close comparison. seriously.

Reviews.Title: Great image, confusing network issues with some apps
Reviews.Author: rtrski "Who, me?"
Reviews.Content: Have had TV for a weekend now.  First, a note on what I'm judging against: my last TV was a Toshiba 52" 'slim' DLP (13" deep, internal projection) at 720p, that didn't even have a built-in tuner, e.g. an "HD-ready" set from about 7 years ago. So maybe anything would have pleased me by comparison!!But by that comparison the picture is night and day.  I've read all the reviews about 'flashlighting' and 'off axis contrast decay' and yadda yadda yadda with edge-lit LED backed LCDs.  I don't care.  It looks brilliant.  In fact the image is so crisp and clean that I can't help feel that shows I formerly thought were a bit 'gritty' and 'realistic' now have an almost unnaturally perfect-lit and colored crispness to them in 1080p, the oft mentioned 'soap opera effect'.  I'm sure I'll get used to that.  At the backlight level I'm set at (haven't entirely settled but running between "11" and "13" on the scale right now) the off-axis contrast is fine; our viewing positions are about 9-11ft from the set and separated by about 3-4' which puts us < 15 degs off 'normal' to the set face.  The glossy screen does glare a little with ambient light, but even thru that the pic is clearer than thru the 'matte' hence more diffused reflection we got at all angles with the DLP set.Built-in tuner is pretty powerful.  Just hooked it up to my in-attic antenna (which has a long cable to get down to the living room) and we picked up every channel the old DirectTV HD receiver did (which also has an OTA tuner, and which we were using even though we stopped our DirecTV subscription several years ago) and then some.  (Maybe part of the benefit is the DTV receiver had to have the OTA/sat multiplexer splitter in line, but then again it also had an inline amp).TV came out of the box stating no new firmware update was necessary, so I'm wondering if they're somehow updating existing stock before shipping as others have needed an update.  Don't recall what number FW it says its on at the moment....might add in a comment if people are curious.The only star minus I'm giving it right now, which may NOT be fair as I describe it further, is that some of the network apps were a b***h to get working!  For the first couple of days I could not for the life of me get either Netflix or the Samsung App Store to load.  I'd confirm my internet connection (tried wired and wireless), could use the browser, could access the trial videos on Hulu+, the Pandora app gave me the option to register the set...but neither Netflix not the Samsung App interface would ever get beyond "Loading" and/or the dreaded "Network Interference Occurred" or "We are unable to connect you to...".  This despite a good connection and being able to use Netflix on any laptop on the same network.  What gives???  So I hooked up the new Blu-Ray player I selected (Panasonic brand, so as to get Amazon VOD which is not available on the Samsungs) and lo and behold, although Amazon worked, Netflix still didn't.  Basically, that was a red flag that it was something in my network.Sure enough, a new wireless router configuration (and although unrelated, a new ADSL2+ cable modem while I was at it), and Netflix and the Samsung App store both load.  Go figure.So fair or not (since the Blu-Ray had the same hassle, and it *was* my network somehow) I'm deducting one star for having to have some sort of perfect network setup to use Netflix (again, laptops and desktops on the same network don't seem to have this issue, so that's my beef).General impressions may change with furthur usage or if something breaks in firmware, but I think given how good it is now I'd be willing to give them a chance if they "break" something to "fix" it in an upcoming (hopefully quick) version.  Of course any new user review like this doesn't factor in long-term reliability.About our setup overall:TV is connected via one HDMI (HDMI2 with ARC) to a new 3D-capable AV receiver, Blu-Ray set to passthru the receiver (1.4a compatible for 3D), Wii connects to receiver as composite video and audio (using AVR to provide the 1080p upscale...might move that to TV and see if it upscales better).  DVD folders from my Sage HDR300 server look really good (those are getting upscaled by the Sage box to 1080p).  Even standard def TV channels look fairly nice given the source quality (and on digital broadcasts, that means they're being upscaled by the TV only from 720p or 1080i, I assume, with the standard def to 'broadcast digital' def upscaling done by the channels).  Blu-Ray from Panasonic does auto-24p when it recognizes incoming content and I did notice that with HDMI passthru to the Samsung the pans were creamy smooth. So I'm not relying on the TV to handle that.  Did notice that Netflix HD streams are a bit less smooth in the pans, so might have to play with the telecine correction and see what mode works best for whichever inputs.  Have not noticed bright banding around the 'black bars' on anamorphic widescreen Blu-rays from the edge lighting yet, but only watched 2 so far.  Nor have I noticed any real flashlighting but again, very limited content watched so far.  Coming from the DLP where blacks weren't really (the matte screen alone resulted in a dark gray), I doubt I'll be disappointed even after more viewing.Not included in review so far:Haven't tried 3D yet, 4 pairs of included glasses are as yet unboxed.  Haven't mounted TV on wall yet, it's just on the stand on the media cabinet in 'front' of where it will eventually be mounted (viewing distance given before includes the extra space, in reality we're a little closer which puts us at a slightly wider viewing angle today).  Have not played with the touch remote - intend to program a Harmony so didn't want to confuse myself with stuff I couldn't emulate in an all-in-one, anyway.  Came with the standard and the touch remote.  Haven't attempted the gesture and voice control either.  Meh.  Only real reason I got the ES8000 vs. dropping down to the ES7500 or even the ES7100 is that a) supposedly had the 'best' dimming processing, and b) it was already out.  The ES7100's will be a couple months yet.Overall, color me impressed.

Reviews.Title: Good, but I am returning it.
Reviews.Author: Brandon Taylor
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV, fell in love and ended up returning it due to a factory defect (a large dead pixel right in the center). I ended up getting a Viera plasma and think it has a much better picture, but I wanted to review this TV since I still feel it is amazing in many ways, and is still a worthy purchase despite its exorbitant price.First off, this TV is sexy; it is simply stunningly designed and looks very elegant. The base is unique, the bezel is almost non existent, and the faux chrome edges and base make the TV slick and stylish. Second, the layout of the menus, the web browser and apps, and look of the on screen guide is as good as it gets. Also, the HDMI and other ports are located on the bottom right, which, to me at least, is ideal.So, why did I return it and not just get a replacement since it was a simple dead pixel defect?*The sluggish speed of loading the apps and web controls*The hand movement gesture feature isn't as glamorous as they claim*The smart remote is buggy, and works intermittently*The white halo blotches. The brighter spots throughout the screen are noticeable during dark scenes*Night scenes are not that great, whereas plasma provides stunning night scenes*I suspect quality control concerns with the TVAll in all, the features to me when I was ordering the TV were extremely cool, but I realized I would never use them. The style was nice, and I miss how sleek it looked, but the picture quality of my new Panasonic GT series is substantially better. I am actually happy about the defect. If you want style, extreme thinness of the TV, the intuitive and elegant menu design, and abundance of apps, then you will love this TV. Just know that plasma TV's do provide a better picture quality, but still have their downfalls. Happy shopping!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: slopyjoe71
Reviews.Content: I have been using this 55 inch TV for over a month now and its amazing.  The picture quality is excellent, 2D and 3D. The voice control and motion control work flawlessly. Just make sure that the room is well lit if you are using motion and the room can't be noisy for voice control, if it is noisy you can just use the mic on the remote, another great feature, so you don't have to shout at the tv. The allshare feature is a plus, you can select folders and files from your computer that the TV can pull up on its screen wirelessly. Another big pro for me is that the TV turns on quickly, not like previous HDTV's that you turn on and you have to wait about 30 seconds for it to power up and turn on. This TV is on in 3 seconds. I highly recommend this TV to anyone looking to buy a new one.  It is definitely worth the money, plus it can be updated in the future. The second remote that comes with the TV can also control my TiVo which is nice because the TiVo remote cannot pull up the menus for the TV and with previous TV's I had to always grab a second remote to do that.I know the review is kind of all over the place, but overall a great TV that I would recommend to everyone. If we buy another TV this year for the man cave it will be this one, but probably the 65 inch.What are you waiting for? Stop reading the reviews. You know you want this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: TY
Reviews.Content: Waited years for a new HDMI TV that I thought was worth having. This is the TV to have. It's not the biggest TV but IMO has the best video quality for my viewing pleasure.Excellent video quality.The wireless internet is nice but the streaming video quality isn't as good as the streaming video I get from my Samsung 3D blu-ray player. Not sure why, but it's significant.If you are plugging in your blu-ray directly into your TV then get a Samsung blu-ray player. Using their BD Wise technology you should get a cleaner picture. But really, if you are going to get this TV then you probably have an AVR and a decent sound system. I ran into some audio sync problems when using my AVR with this TV; the video lagged a bit behind the sound which is very annoying so make sure your AVR has an audio delay feature. I had to adjust my audio to delay by about 7 frames. Right now, my blu-ray player only has one HDMI output which goes to my AVR; if it had two HDMI outputs I would send one the the TV and the other to my AVR; I would think the Samsung blu-ray to Samsung TV would be most ideal but really haven't tested it enough yet. Still waiting on a Samsung blu-ray player with two HDMI outputs.I can't really say enough about the picture quality from this TV. I don't really care about all the bells and whistles. Just give me great picture quality and I'm happy and this TV delivers.The 3D movies I have seen so far are spectacular. Both from blu-ray and on-demand trough my cable service. Buy the more expensive rechargable Samsung glasses. They are rechargable via usb and are guaranteed for life and are much better IMO than the two standard 3D glasses that came with my TV. I have a pluggin 4 port usb nearby my system just for this purpose so I don't have to charge them with my computer. Oh, make sure your AVR is 3D Ready and has an audio delay feature.Lastly, don't be cheap on the HDMI cables. Buy the best you can afford. I got the Monster cable Max 3D hyperspeed 1000 >21Gbps. And only use HDMI cables! You can't get DTS HD audio via digital opt or digital coxial. You must use HDMI !

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN55ES8000 - "THE TV"
Reviews.Author: Subha
Reviews.Content: I bought this at the end of Jan just before the prices went down. I did lot of research between different Samsung models and finally pulled the trigger on this. The models that I considered are UN55ES7150 at Costco and UN55ES7500; This TV is by far the best TV out there if you get a good one and not a lemon. I read so many bad reviews about this TV and was skeptical myself too but then my wife gifted me this TV for my birthday and it turned out very good.Few interesting things about this TV:1.Initially you need to be little patient with this TV as you may not like the picture at first as this TV does take some time(around 3-7 days depending on the usage) to break-in and after that the picture is excellent.2.This TV requires high speed HDMI cables that support 3D, Audio Return Channel & Internet something like this...Mediabridge High Speed HDMI Cable with Ethernet (6 ft) - Ultra Series - Supports Ethernet, 3D, and Audio Return [Newest Standard]. You will be disappointed if you use the cheap old regular HDMI cables.3.The sound from this TV is less compared to the other models I mentioned earier and getting a sound bar is recommended. Something like this...Samsung HW-E450 Wireless AirTrack Sound Bar4.The webcam on the TV is a very useful feature as you can chat with your friends & family via Skype and the controls and features are pretty easy & convenient. The camera can be rotated upwards so that it does not automatically turn on the motion sensor like some complained in the reviews.5.I bought a flat antenna to get the Over the air(OTA) HD channels and the picture is close to real. I have posted some pics in the custom images section.The picture on this TV is stunningly beautiful and the colors are rich & vibrant and the blacks are deep. Edit: I have posted some pics(NFL interview & some TV show pics) that I have taken with my iPhone 5 in the custom images section and the links are listed below just to give you an idea of what I am talking.http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo2BRD6S02T9SR4/B00752NJMChttp://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo2BOETFWFCC1Z/B00752NJMC###Update 3/5/2013####6.The 3D on this TV is actually quite good if you are watching Real/True 3D movies, although I could not watch it for more than 30 mins as it gave me headaches. This TV has a capability of converting regular programming to 3D programming and it is not bad at all but the actual 3D movies have much better effect.7.I found that this TV is much faster than the above mentioned TV models in terms of response time, operation and playing digital content. I connected a 500GB external HDD via USB and the TV reads the media pretty fast with no lag and it plays them great too. I also found that The All Share from my laptop via wifi is also pretty quick while playing the pictures on the TV.I am yet to calibrate my TV with a calibration disk and am waiting for the disk to arrive. Also, I read online that we can connect regular bluetooth keyboard and mouse to this TV. Yet to test that and will let you know how that goes. Until now this is still THE TV :)

Reviews.Title: I don't like the base, remote or glasses but great picture.
Reviews.Author: B. Barnes
Reviews.Content: The picture is really great.  We have Directv and our previous TV was a Samsung LN46B650.  I can definitely tell a difference with the picture.  It seems so much more vibrant than out other TV, and that TV is only 3 years old.We bought the new set from a brick and mortar store.  It fit in the back of our Chevy Equinox perfectly.  My wife and I were able to lift it in the box easily.  Setting it up was harder than the previous TV though.  The LN46B650 slid into a base that you could easily turn from side to side.  The UN55ES8000 base has to be screwed integral to the TV.  The set can be moved because its so light but the pads at the bottom of the base squeak when you adjust it.  Our living room and kitchen are open to each other and it was nice being able to adjust the TV when moving from room to room.I find the remote a little hard to use if we are watching something with the light turned down.  The buttons are so close together that its hard to differentiate the functions by feel, like on our Directv remote.  I wish it was a little larger and could emulate other remotes.I also find the glasses to be a little painful after 15 minutes or so.  I wear sunglasses quite often and never had the pinching feeling that these 3d glasses give me.  I looked at the reviews here on amazon and I guess I'm in the minority with the discomfort level, though my wife doesn't like the pinching either.  I was surprised that the batteries aren't rechargeable either.  The glasses are light though.I wish I could add another half star.  The picture is really good.Update after about 9 months :The picture quality is still great.  I haven't found my self using the gesture control feature at all, too many remotes in the house already.I do hate that they changed the base on the TV. The previous TV base made it so much easier to adjust the TV depending on where we were in the living room.  Adjusting the UN55ES800 with it's integral base sometimes makes we worry about damaging the set.  I really wish there was an aftermarket swivel base.

Reviews.Title: Good and Bad Together
Reviews.Author: Meg
Reviews.Content: After the third set I decided to give up on this tv!This is a great tv in terms of picture quality, colors, design, connections, GUI, calibrations, web browser, skype camera etc.etc., and actually it is one of the most advanced televisions on the market.On the other hand it has huge flaws. All my three sets had big clouding problems (the first had a dead pixel too). In the day light everything was almost acceptable but, in a dark room (also with lights on), big clouds were visible on the bottom and the left and right sides of the screen. Bleeding back-light were visible too in every corner of the screen. Some confusion also in the software that enable/disable the CE dimming and Micro Dimming Ult.: both present in every Mode but not in Movie Mode. In this way the clouding + bleeding effects were amplified.Talking about off-axis viewing, well, the blacks fade to grey easily and the colors wash out when you move from the center position, so it is an issue.The build dates of my sets were February, April and May so it wasn't the case of a single "defective stock". From some forum comes up these problems are still there in the panels built at least until August included.I read that these kinds of problems tend to decrease/vanish after some weeks of use, for this reason I kept (and used) my third set as much as possible (just until the end of the free return window), but in my case no improvement occurred.I know also that this kind of back-light technology (LED Edge-Light) always tends to have some screen uniformity, clouding and bleeding light problem (no matter which brand) but in these Samsung sets is far beyond the acceptable limit.Wonderful tv devastated by a very very poor build and quality control!I have been informed in Europe these kind of problems are not so bad: Why the "quality standard" in the Samsung's Mexican  factory is drastically under the average compared to the others?Samsung must work on this!The last but not the least, I wanna say thank you to Amazon. They took care of my problems providing me three sets of tv including the final return. When I called them for the problems with my third set they honestly suggested to me do not go for the tv nr.4 but simply go for the return+refund  instead. They are already aware of these problems because a lot of costumers are complaining about.Amazon 5 starsSamsung ...1 star

Reviews.Title: BUYER BEWARE!!! FAILURE OF BOTH MY 7000 AND 8000 SERIES SAMSUNG SMART TVS
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: I will NEVER buy another SAMSUNG TV again. I should have learned my lesson when my recently purchased 7000 series Samsung 3D TV failed. I thought it was an isolated incident and couldn't possibly happen again so I decided to take the plunge and buy another Samsung. This time a top-of-the-line 8000 series with all the bells and whistles. Within 3 weeks of owning, a blue line ran vertically down the right side of my screen. Since it was under warranty, I was able to have it repaired at no cost (repair man actually was the only positive part of my experience). That's besides the point -- the TV was only 3 weeks old, now sitting next to my malfunctioning 7000 series TV that was not much older (but now out of warranty). The service technician suggested I contact Samsung to request an accommodation -- I pay labor, Samsung pay for parts. Sounds reasonable so I called Samsung and requested. As you might imagine, Samsung did not entertain the idea, hiding behind a warranty technicality. Of course, Samsung is under no obligation to assist in the repair of my 7000 series, but from a business standpoint, losing a customer who has already purchased (2) of their higher-end models, and the negative publicity I intend to disseminate as a result may make their decision a poor one. As much as they would like to believe this issue is isolated, the countless message boards of customers experiencing the same issue speaks volumes. Maybe lightning struck twice in my case. I for one will not find out the odds of lightning striking a 3rd time. Goodbye Samsung. Consider yourself warned!!!

I chose this model and love it. Crystal clear picture, stunning black and amazingly vivid colors. I decided not to wait for the 2013 SmartTV lineup as the discounts on this 2012 line are unbelievable. For those, who will want to upgrade, the upgrade box (evolution kit) is supposed to launch soon, but I think the display quality is so unprecedented already, that this is the best value for money and will be for some long time.Hookup is simple, but you should spend some time to set your visual settings (contract, brightness levels etc.). The default factory settings would make your picture too bright and black would be too gray. I decreased a lot of those default values and totally love it.The TV can also learn to switch channels of your cable box (I have DirectTV). If only Samsung make a universal remote that you could teach your audio receiver's commands! I hate all remotes and you don't need any for this TV.

Reviews.Content: When the TV showed up the packaging was in great shape. The shipper helped me get it to the room. Setup is a breeze. The thing that took the longest was a few firmware updates when I connected the ethernet cable. Netflix runs very smooth and the picture is very good. I did however notice a stuck pixel centered and one third of the way down from the top of the screen, it was stuck on(clear or white). My heart sunk a little everytime a movie would show a dark screen and my eye would be pulled to the dot. I then checked on Sumsungs policy and was very happy they have a zero pixel tolerance for this model, especially with its location. I had an serviceman in my house three weeks later and even got to help him replace it. Picture is now perfect, but you will find youself switching the picture mode back and forth from "natural" and "movie", depending on what you are watching. One thing I would like to point out, for those of you who are worried about privacy with the camera mounted to the top, like I was; DO NOT WORRY, it has a very small physical knob on the back of the camera that allows you to rotate it down so its lense is completely blocked. If you plan on using it for 3D I would like to warn you that you will have to replace your old HDMI cables for the high speed HDMI cables they sell now. The 3D picture is great and the 3D conversion for normal TV is OK at best, it gives the picture some depth. Amazing TV!

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is great, voice&gesture; control almost useless
Reviews.Author: Tobias
Reviews.Content: I've been using the voice feature for a while and must say, I'm pretty disappointed. Or not so much disappointed, as I was somehow expecting the voice implementation to be way subpar. And boy it is.I've been using Siri for a while now, so I know how a well-implemented voice interface can look like. (Even though I'm not 100% happy with Siri either, which I will write about later). Samsung's promise is to control your TV simply with your voice. The obvious functions would be volume&channel; control, and powering the device on and off.Let's start with the volume. The TV can go up to volume 100, but the voice interface only allows you to control volume levels up to 20. That's just silly and makes it pretty much useless. Furthermore, the recognition of the numbers is pretty inaccurate. When wanting to control the volume relatively, you can say "volume up" and "volume down", but that will change the level in increments of 1, which again is pretty silly, as that will hardly make any difference. Jumps of 5 or 10 (or configurable increments) would've made way more sense.You can mute the TV with your voice, which is a useful feature.Let's move on to channel switching. In a typical set up with a digital DVR or some other external device feeding in the TV content, the channel function obviously doesn't work at all. You're not using the channels of the TV, rather the channel lineup of your DVR. The channel switching function therefore is rendered completely obsolete. Even if you use the TV channel lineup, you can only say numeric channel numbers, not the channel names. Again, that is very silly.Turning the TV on and off works reasonably well. No complaints there. (On the other hand, as you usually have to turn on your DVR as well, you have to reach out to a remote control either way, in which case you might as well hit the button on your TV control as well).What else can you do? You can control the source for the signal (to switch between the different HDMI inputs). That's a good idea, however, the implementation again is suboptimal. You first have to say "Hi TV" to turn on voice control. Then "source", then wait it to be recognized, then "source 2″ or "source 3″ etc., instead of simply saying "source 2″ or "source 3″ right away. So it makes you go through two commands instead of one (or rather: 3, instead of 2). Needless to say how silly that is.I could go on like that, but I think you get the idea. The voice feature in the end is pretty useless. And I do understand the challenges with a room microphone versus one that is close to your face, but still, don't advertise a functioning smart TV if it is not functioning, and not very smart. (And I'm not even talking about the gesture control, which is another pretty useless feature).I can't wait for Apple to come out with a really smart TV. That will be the next device category that they could revolutionize completely (and will, if they try, no doubt about that). Go on, Apple, it's your turn.PS: I love the picture quality of the TV. I didn't buy it for voice&gesture; control, but for bright HD, good 3D, and overall picture quality, which is where it excels.

Reviews.Title: Excellent LED and Samsung Product.
Reviews.Author: Jaciel Torres
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write a review about this Samsung LED tv because I've been seeing a lot of unjust reviews for it.  So I wanted to throw in my honest 2 cents.  I had a Samsung LCD 32inch before I took the plunge and bought this tv.  I like Samsung.  Never really have had any problems and was impressed at the time with the LCD.  That was back in 2009.  SO I wanted to go all out on a tv since we were moving in a new house.  Walking in to my local Best Buy This Samsung UN55ES8000 immediately caught my eye.  The really skinny trim boarders, the quality and colors of the screen, the aesthetics etc.. I was hooked.I bought the tv and had Geek Squad install it the next week.  During that week before the installation, I saw all these mixed reviews.  So I was getting a little nervous about it.  After the installation, all those worries were put to rest.  The TV produces Amazing and I mean AMAZING images and quality.  I'm blown away by the tv.  I"m a heavy gamer and movie watcher and was just blown away of how those media are displayed.  Gears of War 3 look crisp and bright.  The colors really stand out. I even put in the 1989 Batman blu ray and was blown away at the quality.  It looked quite amazing for such an old movie.I saw a lot of worries about the tv being slow or unresponsive.  I have had no problems.  And in fact the TV is very fast.  When switching between Inputs or Samsung App Hub, or just between menu items in general.  It was very VERY responsive and fast.Connected the tv to the network and the tv was also very responsive there too.  I browsed through the app store and they have quite a bit of apps.  You'll get lost for quite sometime browsing through what they have.  I'm glad to see Samsung investing some resources to that app store.  The apps usually don't take up too much space, but unfortunately this tv doesn't come with too much space either.  I don't know if I'll run out cause I only downloaded Skype, Netflix, and Pandora, since those are the only apps that interest me.  But it was quite disappointing to see that they didn't at least include a 2 gig flash memory or something.This tv comes with two remotes.  I was a little disappointed that  it didn't come with a remote that had a full keyboard on the back or separate.  It came with a typical remote that can light up and a second one that you can use as a touch pad.  I have not opened or used that one and to be honest I never will.  Even the Geek Squad guys said the touch pad remote sucked.  So unfortunately that was a little disappointing.Also, as everyone knows by now only 3 HDMI inputs.  My  previous 2009 model Samsung LCD 32inch had 4.  That was a bit of a buzz kill.  IDK how thought that would be an adequate amount but unfortunately now a days we need 4 or more.  It does include 3 USB inputs but I don't see myself using more than 1 or 2 at the most.In regards to voice recognition and the hand movement detection. As soon Geek squad installed my tv, the first thing I did was made sure that those two features were turned off.  I'm not interested in them and never will be.  So there won't be a problem with that. It doesn't interest me whatsoever.  I bought this tv for a TV.  Not a kinect.I also hooked up a Samsung HT-E5400 5.1 Home theater surround system.  I initially had some trouble setting it up because I couldn't get all the speakers to play in true surround.  I'm new when it comes to speaker and home theater systems.  I decided to call Samsung Support and was very pleased that they actually were quite polite and handled the problem effectively.  After hearing all these horror stories about their support in the reviews, I didn't know what to expect.  I had to call them about three times because I had questions about the sound system and every time they were polite and solved the problem or my questions.Conclusion.  If you are looking to go all out on a high end tv.  You won't go wrong with this tv at all.  I'm not only impressed but beyond blown away with the images this tv produces.  The aesthetics are very pleasing to the eye and its very quick and responsive.  I bought a 2 year replacement warranty just to insure my investment.  I really don't understand how people here writing negative reviews didn't do so in the first place.  I know it sucks to buy a new product only to not have it working.  With technology you are subject to failures.  Its just the way it is.  So with any big investment I always try to insure my product. That way should any problems arise, it handled quickly.  You will not regret this tv.  And I'm glad to say that I can at least be living proof that a lot of the negative reviews for this TV are flat out BS.

Reviews.Title: Mixed Feelings
Reviews.Author: StillaYankee
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv from a popular online a/v retailer and it was delivered August 8th.  Today is the 16th and it's back in the box waiting to be picked up for return.  The picture was amazing, easily the best I've seen from any tv after researching thoroughly over 2 months and comparing dozens of models from several companies, including the much heralded plasmas.  There wasn't a single image that appeared blurred or pixelated during the Olympics and football, baseball and hockey might not look this good live!  Having said that, the image out of the box was way too bright for my liking and even after a lot of tweaking was still a little on the bright side.  The blacks sure were real black but again after tweaking things like black suits kind of blended into dark backgrounds though to be fair they didn't look that way out of the box, only after tweaking the tv so I didn't need to wear sunglasses to watch it.  2d-3d works ok.  I wouldn't wnt to uy the tv just because of its upconverting qualities but the 3d from a 3d blu-ray was jaw-dropping.  Transformers 3d looked better on the tv than it did in the theater.  Matter of fact, it wasn't even close.  The Olympics, on the 1 3d channel Fios was nice enough to provide, looked incredible.  Wish they had more 3d content available on Fios, other than the ESPN 3d channel they want to charge even more than the exhorbitant rates I'm already paying for the priviledge to watch.The sound was pretty good in my opinion.  I never once had to turn the volume up nearly as high as on my current Sony, just to hear what people are saying.  Late in the evening I even had the volume on #5 and that was still plenty loud enough in my large family room when the kids were in bed.  I don't understand why anyone would say it has poor sound.The apps are somewhat lacking.  There are some very good ones, and I was shocked to see it had MLB.tv built-in so I didn't need to use my PS3--the picture was even better than on the PS3 too and looked cool in upconverted 3d as well.  Skype worked very well, image was better than on my tablets or the kids Ipods.  Pandora worked fine & sounds great.So why is it going back?  After spending numerous hours over the course of the last week it absolutely refused to play a 3d movie if I had my Onkyo receiver turned on.  Even using an HDMI switch (3d capable) and running 1 cable (using Monster Cable Ultimate) to the tv and 1 to the receiver I would either get an error that the tv couldn't play the 3d content or the receiver just wouldn't output any audio depending on which order I turned my equipment on.  Now, how absurd is this?  I've got a receiver that cost over a grand just a couple of years ago and a $2k+ tv and I can't have them both work at the same time.  Who's brilliant idea was this?  Talk about screwing over the consumer.  Samsung's solution for me is to spend yet more money on a 3d blu-ray player with 2 HDMI outputs!  Cheapest 1 I found was $240.  Either that or a new receiver.  Now there's a heck of a choice.  I wasn't to happy with the idea of watching movies on tv anyway after using my projector on a 120" screen for 12 years.  I could buy a new 3d projector for much less than the cost of this tv and be happier.  But something for a lot of users to keep in mind who have receivers more than a couple of years old.*Update 8/18/2012*  Well, the unthinkable happened in my house--my wife and kids actually talked me out of returning the tv and had me buy a blu ray player with 2 outputs (a Panasonic BDT500 due to the recommendations of Amazon reviewers).  First time this has ever happened, usually it's the other way around!  After putting the 1 year old Sony back up they were all disgusted by how bad the picture looked in comparison to this set.  Anyway, best thing I ever did.  I don't think my receiver has ever sounded so good.  From impeccably clear voices to the tiniest obscure sounds from the surround speakers, it was a real treat.  I have a Sunfire sub and I could feel the massive air movement with some booming bass from across my family room and the concrete floor was vibrating--and that was just with the Lorax 3d!  Can't wait to see and feel Transformers DOTM 3d.Due to the new blu ray player, I've not updated my review to 5 stars but will keep the negative comments for prospective buyers to understand what they may be getting into.  The fact it currently comes with 4 3d active shutter glasses and additional ones are only $20-$30 depending on the store, not to mention the free 26" tv for 1 of my kids really make this a 'reasonable' value at the moment.

Reviews.Title: Do not recommend - Update 4/6/13
Reviews.Author: Lizzy Jones
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV in April of 2012 and after a few weeks we experienced as other reviewers did the on/off of the tv at random hours of the day.  We turned off the motion option and it was fine.  Around November of 2012 the TV would flash solid green, stripes of blue, red, white and green and will not respond to the remote.  The tv will shut off reset, go back to the show you were watching then back to vertical stripes.  The only way to stop it is to unplug the TV.  We called Samsung support they were kind and sent out a repair man, he replaced the motherboard (at least that's what he said) and to call him if it happens again within 90 days, guess what it's now February and the TV is now unplugged and on the wall.  When the tv did work, it was great I loved watching movies and tv shows on it but to pay so much to have something break in under a year is very sad.  I will never buy a Samsung tv again.Update: 4/6/2013: After the third replacement of the mother board, Samsung agreed to replace the TV and even arrange for us to pick up the new TV at BestBuy.  I would totally give 5 stars to Samsung customer service.  They helped out a lot and now we have a new TV  :-)  only thing is it's the same tv model because it's still available but they did have an option if the model isn't available to get something comparable.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV.. When it works. DO NOT BUY!
Reviews.Author: Alex in Underland
Reviews.Content: I was shopping for a 3d slim led tv. Having been extremely satisfied with 3 samsung lcd tv's I've owned in the past, i decided to buy another. I wanted a 46"-60" silver smart tv, with a slim bezel, active 3D, and at least 3 hdmi. I was considering the 7100, 7500, and 8000 and ultimately decided on the 8000 series due to specs and aesthetics.I preferred to higher clear motion rate (CMR) of this tv vs the others.it produced excelent  picture even with fast motion. it also had the voice an motion control functions which seemed very forward thinking. As someone who constantly misplaces the remote i found myself using the voice control a lot. It is in no way as intuitive as Siri on your iPhone but still works well enough for basic tasks. Motion control on the other hand gives mixed results. I found it activated itself randomly. When i use my macbook in front of the tv, it thought the apple logo was my hand every time. Then, it sometimes wouldn't activate when i needed it to. I found i rarely used this feature except when it was a simple task that was quicker than actually reaching for the remote.Aesthetically, this tv is gorgeous! Also, because its silver it goes with any decor. The smooth lines of the base look like a work of art. The bezel is so slim the tv disappears into the night and all you have is a beautiful picture that seems to be floating in midair. samsung outdid themselves with this tv.There is a steep price difference between the 7500 and 8000 models. I finally chose the 8000 55 inch because of a great deal on amazon warehouse deals. After owning the tv for about 3 weeks it began to randomly power itself off and on for no reason. after doing some research i found this is a known issue with all smasung 8000 series tvs. some people have payed upwards of $500 to rplace the motherboard on the tv, which seemed to be the only fix. Luckily i was still within my 30day return window, and shipped the tv back asap. as beautiful as the tv and picture was, it is useless if it only stays powered on for 5 minutes. I cant recommend this tv to anyone. THIS TV IS A DUD!!!! DO NOT BUY!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for me
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: TV deliverd on time and as describbed.  It did have major clouding/ flashlighting issues though and I was not happy with the picture at first.  Let me just say, Samsung is amazing!  When I called tech support.  They told me to give it a couple weeks and see if it went away.  When it didnt, Samsung sent out two techs to my home and swaped out the screen in about 20 minutes.  The picture is now absolutely perfect and the 3d is better than expected. Its so cool to walk in my home and say "hi tv" and it turns on.  The hand gesture controls work very well, almost too well.  In a very bright room the TV will pick up on anything.  If you put your feet up it may think you raised your hand. That said, when I'm extra lazy and dont want to get up and look for thr remote, I will use the hand gestures to change channels and it works 80% of the time.  All in all, I only gave 4 stars because the hand gestures can be fickle and sometimes I have to say "hi tv" a few times before it works.  All the technology is good though and although its a redundancy for me considering I have an Xbox One and PS3 that do all the same things as far as streaming Netflix and such.  The picture is one of the best I've seen and I would recomend this tv to any gamer, movie buff, or technophile out there.

Reviews.Title: Great TV

Reviews.Content: Great TV. I love it. I'm 100% satisfied. I bought this TV about a year back and every dollar that was spent on this is worth. Highly recommended. I bought when it was on sale for about $1600.

Reviews.Title: Everything we wanted...and more
Reviews.Author: Indymom
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV in March of last year and so far have had no problems with it.  When the TV arrived we had the delivery service leave the TV in its boxes as we were getting ready to leave when they arrived but there was no damage due to the delivery service. Our living room is fairly average so I was pleased with the 55"' size (wouldn't go larger unless we have a theater size room).  Purchased a 3D movie to test out the range of the TV and wasn't disappointed with the quality of the TV and the included 3D glasses.Love the internal camera and use Skype on a weekly basis with out of town family and friends.  Have played a little with the other apps and features but really this TV gives us everything we wanted - plus more if we choose to discover!

Reviews.Title: Superior TV
Reviews.Author: dhyard
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Samsung LCD, and the picture quality on this set is just outstanding. The images are so sharp, clear and lifelike, I just love watching it. Also the design of the set is really beautiful.  After spending some time calibrating it, I downloaded a software update and it reset my picture back to factory settings, which turned out to be not too bad, just had to turn the contrast way down and lower the brightness, and make a few other tweaks and the picture looks amazing. The 3D also is awesome, although I don't watch it much. I use the standard mode for general stuff and the movie mode for movies, they both look great depending on your preference.  I wouldn't waste money on calibrating, pretty easy to get this dialed in. Also the sound is good for general TV watching, the low end and bass suffer, there's really no bass, I use my home theater system for movies and when I want quality sound.The screen uniformity is really good, I had a D7000 last year that I returned because of clouding and flashlighting, and this set is far better, though not quite perfect.As for the bad, the internet is terrible, I tried to watch a video on Hulu, and couldn't even get it to load, and on CBS website, could not even get a show to play without starting and stopping.  Maybe it would work better with a wired connection, but even with my router in the same room with a 20mbs speed, the wifi is slow. The apps do seem to work well if you want to pay monthly fees.  The voice features suck, not even worth using. The Samsung phones are so far superior to the TV for these features it's ridiculous. I guess if Apple comes out with a TV, Samsung can just copy it and give us an update.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN55ES8000
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner1970
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN55ES8000 55-Inch 1080p 240Hz 3D Slim LED HDTV (Silver)  First off it is absolutely beautiful when it's off or when it's on.  Great design. There is only one thing I can say........WOW.............  Having one of the newer samsung smart TV's I was hoping for some improvements, but this TV has not disappointed me in one way. I only wish there was a way to load my business software on it so I can use my TV soley.  I also purchased the keyboard with the TV.  I recommend the keyboard because the remote is too slow.  The keyboard is as awsome as the TV. It's a must.The facial reconition works flawlessly to sign in to all my social and shopping accounts. The hand movements to control different operations works well but I feel a little silly letting people see me talking and waving at my TV. It works tho.I haven't used the 3D portion of the TV yet.  I'm waiting for the grandkids to come over.  I have a feeling it will blow us all away......Grandkids better hurry up tho grandpa can only wait so long.100% satisfied with this 8000 model and can't wait until the 9000 comes down within my budget.  I still have bedrooms that need TV's and they love to be rotated.

Reviews.Title: UN55ES800 SAMSUNG TV
Reviews.Author: Dewey
Reviews.Content: I have checked out only a few of the features of this Great TV.  I almost never buy the top of the line but decided to do so on this one for future use.  Have had it only a month but enjoy it tremendously.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Incredible product, but what a learning curve
Reviews.Author: Gregory C. Daley "Ship Captain"
Reviews.Content: Buying a TV, an expensive TV online, was a big risk.  But Samsung is quality.  Packaging was great.  TV delivered without issue.  It takes quite a while to learn what all the bells and whistles do on the TV.  But once you get going, it is addictive.  There is no TV that comes close in quality to this one.  The features are incredible.  My guess about lack of documentation is that the documentation is having trouble keeping up with the change in technology.  I am so happy with my TV!

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN55ES8000
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Tankersley
Reviews.Content: Just received my tv today and not noticed any of the complaints the other reviewer is having. The picture quality in HD and 3D is very good standard definition is just standard it is not much any tv can do for low quality signal. The voice and gesture controls were easy to setup and they work just fine. I have notSamsung UN55ES8000 55-Inch 1080p 240Hz 3D Slim LED HDTV (Silver) had time to get into calibrating the color and other settings. I gave the tv five stars because it was everything I thought it would be. I don't think any tv will be perfect, but is close.

Reviews.Title: I brought mine at Sears, since Amazon won't ship to me!
Reviews.Author: roaeja "Hey you!"
Reviews.Content: Forget about the Beta cloud game gadget from Samsung.  I have a 7mb pipe and it won't run.  Says I don't have fast enough internet speed.  I guess they want 50mb's and fiber optics piped in!!  Samsung is all hot air and even their service center sucks.  I would go with a different brand.If you don't have a cable modem with 25mb's pipe, then forget it.  Evenif you do, Samsung server keeps stalling out and reloading.  They needsome serious compression or this isn't going to fly.  And the motiondetection is a bill of goods, with the voice a close second.  Next timeI will go with a Sony and picture quality, leave the gimmicks to Samsung.Although their SH100 digital camera is a charm to use and it can talkto my Samsung tv.  Maybe they will this and make me a happy camper?

Reviews.Title: I'm having some problems
Reviews.Author: TXAlex
Reviews.Content: So I purchased a 55d8000 a couple weeks ago and it had always on blue pixels so I returned it to find that no more d8000 are available and the new es8000 is.  So I bit the bullet and paid the premium for the 2012 unit.So far my screen is freezing then resetting. It gets really slow and non responsive. This is surprising for a dual-core system that is supposed to be fast. I may have a defective screen.  I will call Samsung tomorrow.Additionally, it doesn't recognize my TVMobliLe server which all of my 2011 model TVs do recognize.I'm getting slightly disenchanted.  Hopefully Samsung will be able to give me some answers. I have a feeling that a RMA/advanced replacement is in my future.  Updates coming soon.UPDATE 3/21/2012I spoke with Samsung support for an hour+. Apparently they do not know now to service the screen as the only instruction they would tell me to do is hold down the exit button the remote control and then act puzzled when nothing happened.  Supposedly, after ten seconds of holding that the exit key for 10 seconds the TV is supposed to reset to factory defaults.  Since nothing happened they had me unplug it a lot of times and try the same thing over and over again.Eventually, they said they could send someone over to repair it which is not exactly what I had in mind.The thing still randomly resets when watching any source and freeze when using apps.I have contacted Amazon.  The large item department was was closed so I am waiting for a call back.I'm leaning towards returning for refund and looking at other products.  The problem is that this screen is a looker and very low profile while having a good size image.  I have not seen the problems others have seen with uniformity.  in fact using the testing patterns it is quite uniform.  Needed a bit of adjustment as it was a bit warm in color temp.  For my application the screen would be great if it worked.A couple of thinks I forgot to mention.  The sheet metal back doesn't seem attached correctly as it has a ripple and the camera was not seated in it's home when I took the screen out of the box, it easily snapped back in place but seems like a quality control problem.

Reviews.Title: The Clouding Issues Kill it!
Reviews.Author: residentj
Reviews.Content: God how I wanted to keep and love this TV. I got it from Warehouse Deals at a fantastic price, used - like new.  Sadly though, the clouding is a huge issue. During the day or in a bright room, you won't notice it much. It's at night or in a dark room that these little lights stand out like a sore thumb and they seem to affect the entire screen.  Just google es8000 clouding and check out all the images. Mine looks just the same. I'll attach some pictures.  Anyway... So sad, for such a beautiful TV!  My UN46C7000 had a little bit of clouding, but nothing compared to this.  You just can't watch a movie with big white patches on it anytime there is a dark scene.  I've decided I'm going to buy a Plasma instead.  Seems the way to go for Movie lovers!  Good luck to you if you decide to buy it.

Reviews.Title: limited
Reviews.Author: Mr. Mark J. Ainsworth "whethermanm"
Reviews.Content: I expected this to be a better version of an LCD 40 inch tv I purchased from Samsung about 6 years ago, which had a seamless Hi def pic with few flaws. This Samsung has sometimes has a grainy, shimmering, and unstable picture. At times, the picture jumps and has jitters. I have messed with the picture settings and have adjusted the picture so it is better but cannot achieve the picture clarity and stability of the 40" model of 6 yrs ago. very unsatisfying for the money. I have blu-ray and the picture is much better and approaches the picture quality, after the adjustments, but jumps. these jumps don't happen when there is a chase scene or much movement, but when there is a love scene or a scene where they sit and converse. what a disappointment :-(!!! not worth the $ I paid for sure!

Reviews.Title: Could have been...
Reviews.Author: J. Herrera
Reviews.Content: The tv is beautiful and the image from Direct or Dish is stunning, however, my Apple tv's videos are terrible. They look grainy, cloudy, and distorted. I have found other users with the same issue on Apple forums. My old Sony LCD had no issues.I hope Samsung finds a fix for this very soon. I feel quite dissapointed after spending so much money for a tv.

Reviews.Title: TURNS OFF AND ON BY ITSELF
Reviews.Author: L. Tolman
Reviews.Content: Had this tv for 2 days now and when i hook my ipad up to the componet side and listen to some audio/video the tv turns off every hour or so and turns back on.  Called Samsung and sending out a tech.  Uggh

Reviews.Title: I wanted so much
Reviews.Author: Angelo Pierini
Reviews.Content: I wanted this product so much for so long, and now i have it! im so proud! and happy thanks to Paul's TV for shipping me this Television!

Reviews.Title: Very dissapointing for a samsung TV
Reviews.Author: E. A. L. R.
Reviews.Content: I was very happy the first month a owned that TV. It has a terrific image quality, it loogs great in my living room but, after one month, something happened. The TV started to randomly reboot by itself. At the beginning I didn't take so much care about this issue because it happened a few times. However, the frequency of reboots increase, and now a new element was added to the overall bad behaviour: some times the image freeze several seconds before the reboot comes.From my personal point of view this is an issue of the TV software. I remember the days when a TV was only a TV and did its job well. Know the TV is like a computer, but until the software and the CPU added will not be stable, it is better to led the TV idiot but functional.I hope to receive a good answer from samsung support department, but if I have the opportunity to buy a new TV, for sure I will stay away from samsung smart tv

Reviews.Title: Great Picture but that's it...
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D. Sullins
Reviews.Content: The Picture Quality is great but I can't say anything great about this set other than that.  Before I get into it, I'm not here to bash Samsung or steer anyone away from this set or Samsung.  I like Samsung and I think they have a great Picture to their sets but this TV was without a doubt bad.  Horrible flashlighting, V-Shaped Light Bleed above logo, and bad motion resolution.  Other owners have said the light bleed and flashlighting go away after time but I had a 30 Day Warranty and wasn't going to take the chance.  Camera hoopla and everything in between is cool but it's lackluster and doesn't work properly.  This is all after the so-called "miracle" Firmware Update that everyone rants and raves about.  Piece of S***, IMO.  Don't buy this set if you're at all concerned with screen uniformity, black levels, or motion resolution.  If you get a Samsung Panel, TS01/02 it does have very nice Picture Quality.  This TV was so bad I didn't bother to review the 3-D.

Reviews.Title: WAS an Awesome TV. Having problems with the Network connection
Reviews.Author: Eric Nielsen
Reviews.Content: Have to rewrite about this tv. Had it less than 3 months and something has gone wrong. Network will not recognize anything to hook up for apps. On and off the voice control and motion control works. Won't take a usb update so I can fix the problem as support suggested. Hoping they will just send me a new tv. I will keep you informed. 6/10/13Original comments:TV works awesome. As soon as you get it set up it will need a software update for a flicker problem but after that you are golden. However if you are not tech savy make sure you know someone that is. You are going to need to add  some #'s to your high speed modem for the wireless part. Just take yourtime and read the instructions for everything. The instructions are simple.

Reviews.Title: A slick TV
Reviews.Author: hi
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV primarily because I wanted a way to connect to the internet and use apps to watch TV. I also got this TV in particular because of its slick design and thin bezel. The TV is georgeous and the refresh rate is stunning (240Hz).Reviews stating that clouding is an issue are really knit picking. If you look very closely on a black screen then yes, you will see some "lighter" areas, but that is the nature of LED. People should be aware of this before purchasing considering LED. But I never notice this when I am watching a movie so this is not really a con for me.My main concern I have with this TV is the Samsung software. You would think with a dual core processor, samsung would be able to run their apps smoothly, but I have had a lot of issues with lag. This is only present in the Samsung apps. Netflix and youtube are perfectly fine. I think this may just be because they did not take the time to optimize their apps.The motion control functionality is cool to show off to your friends, but is not used regularly. The camera is nice for Skype however. The voice control is actually pretty useful on this television. I would say about 75% of the time, I turn on my TV by voice activation "Hi TV. Power on".Aside from that, the only other con I have is the smart remote. For me it has been very slow and buggy which is why I opt to use the traditional remote that is also included.I haven't had an opportunity to watch a 3D movie on this TV, but I am confident that it will look great!

Reviews.Title: Close to perfection but no cigar
Reviews.Author: Mrs. L. SUFI
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for almost 7 months and had noticed the clouding and flash lighting, predominantly on the left hand side of the TV. I have lived with it and was reassured that this will be rectified with correct calibration and future FW updates.Anyhow, long story short, the TV delivers superb colours and contrast during daytime viewing but when the lights are off and I want to watch a favourite blu-ray, the clouding is unbearable for me. All the FW updates have been done, I have tried various tweaks with the settings but to no avail.Luckily for me, mine is being replaced for the new F8000 at no extra cost...Fingers crossed the new one's better.

Reviews.Title: Love the brightness and clarity.....
Reviews.Author: RonE... "RonE..."
Reviews.Content: I really like the picture on this tv, even more than I like the picture on my 73" DLP!!! I love that it is bright and clear. The styling is nice also. The tv does do some "weird" things occasionally like sound disappears momentarily, but I either turn volume back on, or just wait a few seconds and it "corrects" itself!!! I haven't experienced any of the other problems, so far, that other owners of this tv say they have experienced. For now I'm very happy with this tv purchase. Angry bird's hand gestures are a pain, and some other attributes of the "SMARTNESS" of this tv leave something to be desired, but generally it's good tv for watching...lol!!!

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: C. Z. G
Reviews.Content: We were skeptical buying a tv from Amazon. But this is a great tv. It has tons of features and the picture is very clear. There's not too much glare which was a concern with a LED tv. The colors look great as well. I'm not a big fan of the motion and voice command options. They tend to activate for no apparent reason. So we just turned off those features.But my husband and I are very happy with this TV set.

Reviews.Title: The absolute newest model of this TV is fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Me "lru"
Reviews.Content: Worked great out of the box with both Dish Network and internet.  The slide your finger remote is very hard to use however.  It comes loaded with bloatware just like a cell phone.  Can't install it, eats limited memory.  I don't have HDTV Dish but it looks great wo it.  I watch more internet tv than Dish.  So, Dish watch out.  With 50/50 programming / commercials I may just drop you.  Must have a DVR.  I researched tv's for a year.  Glad I waited for this one.  I used to sell tv's.  Reminds me of a huge Sony1970's Trinitritron with 10 times the resolution.  3D is great.  Must have a 55" or better if you like 3D.  I recommend the tv totally.  Local store met Amazon's price so I can't comment on shipping etc.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, But I can't Purchase Apps!
Reviews.Author: Chicago_Jim
Reviews.Content: I've owned this TV for about 2 months. The TV looks great and the picture is excellent, *but* I can't purchase any apps. After numerous calls to Samsung with no resolution, Samsung finally admitted to me that there is a problem with the credit card registration part of their website. This means that even though I have a valid credit card registered on Samsung's web site, when I attempt to purchase an app on the TV, I get a "no credit card registered at Samsung.com" error. Samsung says they are are "working on a fix", but there is no ETA. I have had this problem since I owned this TV (2 months). They told me they have been getting a "high volume of calls" about this issue, so I'm hoping for a fix soon. Free apps download fine, but if you buy this TV be aware that you may not be able to purchase any apps until they come up with some kind of fix!

Reviews.Title: WOW in the box.
Reviews.Author: Isaiah M Chavez
Reviews.Content: This Samsung TV has been amazing since day one.  The crisp contrast ratio and the smoothness of various sports amazes me.  The Smart TV apps are very nice (esp. the AP Ticker and Weather).  I am glad I got mine with the FREE Sound Bar because it adds a lot of expansive sounds.  The 3D is simply BEAUTIFUL.  I really feel like I am in it.  What more can I say?  The setup was quick and simple and everything looks great.  This is a must for anyone that wants a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Great t.v for great price
Reviews.Author: Desi "desi"
Reviews.Content: This was my first Big screen T.V and I loved it.I read reviewes of lot of T.Vs and did lot of comparisions and zeroed in on Samsung and Sony. This was more what i was looking for in terms of size and money.its been a month and picture is great. 3-D movies are fantasticI saw lot of ppl complain about remote i had no such problems Its accurate and response is pretty fast. Its missing a keyboard so i downloaded hthe Android Samsung app(free form samsung)  and Boom  i have the keyboard in palm of my hand and no extra device.My only complaint was sound and best buy gave a smasung surround sound free with it its no BOSE but good enough for my living room

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money & not good for web surfing
Reviews.Author: PC
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes of browsing the internet and watching the same free Hulu, other video, and just net browsing, as I do on my computers. The fact of it is that the browser is lousy. It does not have the same processing abilities as your computers (it takes four to five times longer to load a web page) and is limited to a very few video file formats. In fact, there is only one compatible format. So, for all practical purposes, it is not functional. The keyboard & mouse functions are also quirky, but so what, if the internet doesn't work well it's not a concern.I wasted over $ 1,000.0 to get the net on a TV and I ended up with nothing more than I had before except a TV that was 4 years newer. I really feel sorry for those who bought larger Samsungs with the same fault and paid much more.If you are interest in good surfing abilities with a TV sized display your best bet is a laptop with an HDMI port to feed the video signal to the TV. At list prices the laptop and TV display combination will cost less than a Smart Samsung TV by quite a bit.On the plus side, they do have a nice picture but so do their un-smart TVs for much less. I thought I did a fair amount of research on many brands and models. Unfortunately, I never discovered Samsung's poor web performance until a Samsung chat support person told me it was "normal". She even gave me a link describing the limitations.Note Chat Persons name has been changed to 'REP'."REP: [...]REP: You will have complete information in the above lik.REP: *link.P: are such slow downloading capabilities normal?P: I am sure the wireless is set up properlyREP: Yes, it is normal."

Reviews.Title: Crashes my Tivo Premiere using HDMI
Reviews.Author: Tom Fakes
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice TV, except for the issue I've found with my Tivo Premiere.On hooking up the TV, we noticed that the Tivo had rebooted and was at the first startup screen.  After a while, this went away, and a few minutes later, the Tivo rebooted and showed the same screen again.  Previously, I've seen this when a hard disk in the Tivo fails.After a lot of looking around and trying stuff - e.g. turn off the TV, wait for the Tivo to boot up and hear the live TV sound from my receiver, turn on the TV and the Tivo reboots! - we switched from HDMI to Component/Optical cables and everything works as expected.I'm hoping Samsung releases a firmware update soon to solve this problem.

Reviews.Title: Paul's TV
Reviews.Author: Eason "Eason Wang"
Reviews.Content: Paul's TV called me up and said they didn't have this TV in stock because it was last year's model so they couldn't fulfill the order.  Instead, they gave me this year's model for no extra charge.  That was awesome of them.  And the TV is awesome.  Definitely get this year's model.  The app store for samsung is still in its infancy but I expect they'll add more.  The gesture feature is OK.  Its not that useful to me.  The remote is simple but searching titles on it can be exhausting.  But for youtube, you can connect your smartphone or ipad and use that to search.  Picture quality is awesome as well.  It's so clear that you can see every wrinkle on a person's face.  And the refresh is so fast and smooth that shows look like you're right there.  It is expensive but I think a TV is an investment.  Dollar value will decrease in time but you have to be comfortable with your TV.  Overall, excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Beauty doesn't last
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: The TV has the best design, features and picture quality of anything in its price range, but unfortunately isn't reliable at all. Problems started early on with the unit refusing to connect to my in-home wifi network, SmartHub refusing to launch, and an occasional freeze. Now, several months after purchase, the TV freezes within 30 seconds of launch, displaying vertical colored lines on a black screen, and then reboots. The cycle than repeats perpetually. Haven't contacted Samsung yet due to a tight work schedule, and will update the review once I do. The only piece of advice for now: skip the 'smart' models in favor of less feature-packed ones.UPD 7/30/13As promised, here's the update on my dealings with Samsung. This is the actual message I sent to the support department.Good morning,I have a problem with my LED TV. The unit freezes unexpectedly during operation, displaying a random color pattern (see attached image for example), and then reboots. Upon reboot, the same issue occurs immediately and the cycle continues until unit is physically disconnected from power outlet. Steps taken:1. Live chat with Samsung - directed to switch power outlets, etc. No result2. Attempted to order repair online - registration form says my address doesn't exist and the serial # is wrong (Serial # image attached)Please contact me ASAP to schedule a repair.

Reviews.Title: gorgeous

Reviews.Title: Great...but not fantastic

Overall, I think Samsung has some work to do with the camera/voice options, but they still make a great picture which is more important.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST TV I HAVE EVER OWNED.........

Reviews.Content: I"ve only had this Samsung TV a few days now, but I have some experience, as I also own the Samsung 46 inch smart TV as well........But this 55 inch Samsung 8000 series TV, is by far the most technologically advanced TV on the planet. all the others are busy tying to play catch up, however theres a reason why Samsung tablets, cell phones sell so well..........when I first finished  hooking up this TV, and had it up and connectected to my wireless Wi-Fi System in my home, which I might add, was really pretty easy, "m a baby boomer and by no means a techie, and If I could do it, anyone can.......the picture quality is STELLAR!!........its almost life like, the detail, the vibrancy.is just sometihing that needs to be seen to believe, If you considering purchaseing this TV, I urge you to do so, believe this baby boomer, you wont be sorry!!!

Reviews.Title: un55ES8000 - where is the backlit led bleeding?
Reviews.Author: chetan
Reviews.Content: i bought this tv not from amazon but from external website but still want to review it.I have made 2 buys recently after seeing lot of amazon reviews most of which were against my buy!one was altec lansing in air 5000 and 2nd is this TV.And now beleive its always good to risk buying something better than just bias it on amazon reviews!so many! so many people complained about led backlight bleeding and what not!!this tv is awesome.. its worth$2400 for just its design and picture quality itself..and i dont even care about 3d glasses, smarttv, hand gestures etc!!buts its better to buy a next gen tv than buy a cheaper older generation TV!Active 3d is quite amazing although i never cared before.. the glasses nicely adjust itself to get the theatre like experience.i Did not like the touch remote however, its really painful, i wish samsung retained a qwerty keyboard at the back!this touch remote will take so much time to type a few letters!!!! painful!solution is to get a wireless keyboard.. instead...I searched a lot if this TV could get connected to a bose sound dock 10 easily via aux port!! i had no such answers!!i was searching online if i shud use a digital optical output and use a Digital to analog convertor and hook the tv to my bose sound dock!!but turns out this tv has  a direct AUX out!! you can directly connect to any aux input like your external speakers!one more good thing is that i can have both my tv speakers and bose together!! tv speakers give a nice room fill effect , while bose gives a nice deep base filling my room into a home theatre experience for no extra money or setup!!anyways! do go check out cnet and other reviews for this tv!!but yeah its awesome!! i played fifa 13 on it!! Reviews.Title: Should better

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: X
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding TV.  Picture is stunning out of the box.  No adjustments were necessary.  I am glad that we disregarded the negative reviews for the most part.  couldnt be happier with the product.To address some of the negative reviews:  perhaps the firmware updates have fixed the earlier issues.  the voice recognition is great.  the motion recognition is ok.  if it was better perhaps we would use it more but as it is we dont have much need for it, especially with the voice recognition capabilities.  And in fact neither of these functions are necessary as the remote works fine.  The second touch pad remote also functions as a microphone for voice recognition.  Not sure if anyone ever pointed that out in the reviews.  You don’t need it for voice recognition, but it may help if the room is noisy and you misplaced your regular remote ;).The tv has a 2D to 3D conversion feature which just amazed us.  we plugged a thumb drive that had our pics on it into the usb port to view our photos.  We then used the 2D to 3D conversion to test the feature, and wow!  We were truly amazed that the tv converted our pics to 3D (with the help of the active 3D glasses of course).The tv also has whats called a “Soft AP” (access point.  Without getting too technical, it basically means that you can plug an internet cable into the tv and it will send out a secure wireless signal that you can use with your phone, tablet, etc.  you can set your own security code for the wireless signal too.  We use it in a part of our building where our wireless signal is weakest in order to expand our wireless capabilities without additional costs.The tv has on and off timers to program if/when you want it to be on or off which we think is great, since we bought this for our place of business.  In fact, we loved this tv so much that we 2 more (another 55” and a 65” unit ).Skype and all the apps work very well.  It also has a video record feature!  All this and much more…plus it looks fantastic!  Everyone raves about these units.  Also, no need for an expensive wall mount. Reviews.Title: "Taxi Wave" and "Orange Squeeze"
Reviews.Author: Deepti
Reviews.Content: This is a new feature on the Samsung UN55ES8000. It's crazy and cool at the same time. Ever want to talk to your TV? How about yell at it? Now you can and it will or may listen to you and obey your command. At least you will be able to turn it on and off that way. There is also facial recognition software. This allows the TV to single you out to know your own settings. The motion-by-hand control allows you to bring up then select options and settings and Smart TV selections. You just kind of wave your hand in front of it, let's call it the taxi wave. Do the taxi wave and the various options will appear at the bottom of the screen. Those are your choices. Now, take control of the mouse on screen with your hand by directing the mouse to it and select one by closing your hand. Let's call this closing motion the "orange squeeze." The front facing camera on top of the screen allows all this to take place. That and the "brains" in the TV.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful but with problems
Reviews.Author: M. Scotte "M. Scotte"
Reviews.Content: The beauty of this TV speaks for itself. It is very slim and the base is unique and styled in a contemporary way. However, the picture quality and other technology has a number of problems. I am too busy to go into details, but the bottom line is, if you crave design/style and are okay with a mediocre picture, buy this TV, otherwise you may want to try another set.UPDATE:My gripe with this TV is that the picture quality is mediocre for the price. This is supposed to be Samsung's flagship TV for 2012, yet the picture quality is comparable to my Sony LCD from a few years back.I will start with the negatives of the picture quality of which this TV has many:The picture is noisy/grainy. If you watch this TV from more than 5 feet away, you will probably not notice the graininess, but if you watch it any closer, you will definitely see the pixels. This was even the case for HD Blu-ray movies.Next, the TV has a narrow viewing angle. If you watch this TV straight on, the colors are beautiful, but if you deviate from the center, you will immediately notice a rather drastic wash-out effect on the colors. It almost looks like there is a thin gray haze covering the picture from off angles.Samsung also claims this TV has smooth motion 960, but this poorly executed at best. In fast action scenes, the blur is very obvious. My 4 year old Sony TV has better motion smoothing than this TV.In all honesty I can only think of two good things about this TV. The first is the colors are vibrant when viewed straight on. Secondly, the black levels on this TV are good.

If you want the dang tv, go buy it, stop looking at ANY reviews.
